intro: Gomphandra penangiana, commonly known as the Penang gomphandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Peninsular Malaysia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in shaded, humid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss, Gomphandra penangiana is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
